FILE: cm220437v11.0.txt
DYAD: IVORY COAST-FRANCE

PS: 19600807-19750806 0.5 20041106-20051018 .25 20051019-20101018 .5

PS-UPDATE2020:Revision based on a new relationship rule that when a rivalry terminates and the rivalry is the only basis for a relationship, then the relationship continues for 5 years and is coded as negative peace (.5) and then the relationship ends thereafter.


PSNOTES: 15 year, post-colonial rule applied

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20220222
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20220222

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID4371 

TERRMID: MID4371 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4371 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4371 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4371 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4371 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4371 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID4371 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4371 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4371 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4371 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID4371 from cm narrative, Ivory Coast war planes bombed French military planes at an airport in Ivory Coast. French military units were in Ivory Coast acting as peacekeepers between the Ivory Coast government and rebel factions. From NYT 11/7/2004, an American civilian was also killed, bringing the US into this MID. Coded civil war MID because civil war activity in Ivory Coast drove this MID. 

CIVWARLINK: MID4371 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4371 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES:

COUPMID-CER: MID4371 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4371 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4371 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4382 

TERRMID: MID4382 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID4382 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID4382 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID4382 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID4382 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID4382 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID4382 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID4382 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID4382 1 -- civil war MID
CIVWARMID-CER: MID4382 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID4382 from cm narrative, following the events of MID4371, France declared that any provocations against its forces by Ivorian forces would be met with force. A short time later, France also deployed nine additional tanks to the country as part of its peace-keeping operation. First day of dispute was on 10/18/2005 and last day of dispute was on 10/18/2005. Coded civil war MID because France was in Ivory Coast to stop/prevent civil conflict, and an earlier Ivorian attack triggered this MID. 

CIVWARLINK: MID4382 3 -- not civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID4382 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID4382 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID4382 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID4382 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID4382 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

MID4 2002-2010:

MID4371
rivalry=220437 nationa=IVORY COAST nationb=FRANCE MID4371 20041106-20050506 
 revtype1a=POLICY revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=USE OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=POLICY revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=1-25 DEATHS fatalpb=9 lhostb=
USE OF FORCE 

On November 6, 2004, Ivory Coast war planes bombed French military units at an airport in Ivory Coast. The French military units were in Ivory Coast acting as peacekeepers between Ivorian government and rebel factions. Following the attack, Ivorian ground units exchanged fire with French units before retreating. In response to the two attacks, the French forces on the ground destroyed 2 Ivorian fighter jets at the airport, and France sent three fighter jets to the Gabonese capital Libreville in case of further attacks. First day of dispute was on 11/6/2004 and last day of dispute was on 5/6/2005.

MID4382
rivalry=220437 nationa=FRANCE nationb=IVORY COAST MID4382 20051018-20051018 
 revtype1a=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2a=NOT APPLICABLE fatala=NONE fatalpa=0 lhosta=DISPLAY OF FORCE 
 revtype1b=NOT APPLICABLE revtype2b=NOT APPLICABLE fatalb=NONE
fatalpb=0 lhostb=NO MILITARIZED ACTION 

Following the events of MID4371, France declared that any provocations against its forces in CDI by Ivorian forces would be met with force. A short time later, France also deployed nine additional tanks to the country as part of its peace-keeping operation. First day of dispute was on 10/18/2005 and last day of dispute was on 10/18/2005.

SOURCES

Somini Sengupta. "Ivory Coast Violence Flares; 9 French and 1 US Death." New York Times 11/7/2004. Accessed 6/3/2017. http://www.nytimes.com/2004/11/07/world/africa/ivory-coast-violence-flares-9-french-and-1-us-death.html
